Positive selection screening¶

Arthur Zwaenepoel

class wgd.positive_selection.PositiveSelection(gene_pattern, gene_families, nucleotide, protein, species='pos', muscle_path='muscle', codeml_path='codeml', tmp_dir='./', output_dir='./')¶

Class for performing positive selection screen. Highly similar to KsDistribution Required parameters:

Parameters:
  • species – species id
  • gene_pattern – gene pattern (regex for parsing out species specfic genes from gene families)
  • gene_families – gene families file
  • nucleotide – fasta file containing all nucleotide sequences (CDS) for all species.
  • protein – fasta file containing all protein sequences for all species.
__init__(gene_pattern, gene_families, nucleotide, protein, species='pos', muscle_path='muscle', codeml_path='codeml', tmp_dir='./', output_dir='./')¶

init for positive selection class.

Parameters:
  • gene_pattern – gene pattern (regex for parsing out species specfic genes from gene families)
  • gene_families – gene families file
  • nucleotide – fasta file containing all nucleotide sequences (CDS) for all species
  • protein – fasta file containing all protein sequences for all species
  • species – species id
  • muscle_path – path to muscle executable
  • codeml_path – path to codeml executable
  • tmp_dir – path to tmp directory
  • output_dir – path to output directory
positive_selection(check=True, preserve=False, prompt=True, times=1)¶

Calculates for each non-singleton gene of a species of interest the mean Kn/Ks (omega) value. This is performed by performing codeml analysis.

Parameters:
  • check – boolean, check directories if present/empty?
  • preserve – boolean, preserve intermediate files?
  • prompt – boolean, prompt for possible overwriting?
Returns:

data frame
wgd.positive_selection._mean_for_genes(data_frame, gene_pattern)¶

Get the mean omega value for all genes of a species :param data_frame: :param gene_pattern: :return:

Example: performing screen¶

To perform a full positive selection screen for a gene family file and a species of interest, one can do something like this:

from wgd import positive_selection

pos = PositiveSelection(species='Arabidopsis thaliana', gene_pattern='AT.+', gene_families='OrthoMCL_out.txt',
                        nucleotide='nucleotide.fasta', output_dir='./test_w', tmp_dir='./tmp')
pos.positive_selection()

In fact, this is the pipeline as implemented in the command line utility wgd pos (see Command line interface)
